item.title: Wall severely cracked, about to fall on pavement, 27th November
item.description:
The retaining wall on the southern corner of Allison Road and Wightman Road is cracked in four or five places and is leaning at a 10° angle towards the pavement. I am concerned that it is likely to topple and injure a pacifier.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wightman Road, Harringay, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadside Gully Blocked, 27th November
item.description:
Roadside gully blocked. Drain has been blocked and becomes a hazard during wet and freezing conditions. Has been a problem for over a year. Called Thames water who came out and said i should report to the council. Drain is located outside the Kia garage and the adjacent carpark (Dunbar avenue carpark)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunbar Avenue, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several lights out, 27th November
item.description:
At least 3 lamp post are out on the pathway at the top of norman road as it meets belvedere park These leaves the path pitch black from early eve onwards ( made even worse by the fact you are hit in the eye by the bright light from the pub on the other side of the park ) It all feels very dangerous and no matter how many times it’s reported they all fail again shortly after Can this be looked into with urgency

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
